intro: Boronia pancheri, commonly known as the Kangaroo Island boronia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal heathlands and is known for its delicate, slender leaves. It is a small shrub that can reach up to 1 meter in height. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
